content.description: Starts on the side pull slopey hold at head height of the slab and climbs into the higher start. May need to stack Â pads or walk up a cheat block to reach hand/foot holds- first ascent was done with a few feet of snow bringing up the landing quite a bit.
content.protection: As many pads as possible. And a pad for the downclimb on the back.
content.location: Tall vert face on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: Starts on an obvious long crimp rail accessible via a tall cheat block on the left side. Climb up with lots of high feet until a good jug and crimp just below the lip. Pretty tall and committing, but has a flat landing that has been fallen on with no injury. Down climb is arguably harder then the climb itself but is on the back side of the boulder.
content.protection: As many pads as possible. And a pad for the downclimb on the back.
content.location: Tall vert face on the north side of the boulder.

content.description: While in technicality this boulder does hold a warm up harboring a v1, it is tall and committing but with a good landing.
